title: How to carry yourself out of bronze
body:
Here is a visual guide on how carrying can't help you win games. 

http://i.imgur.com/tM9LxRr.png

The problem in bronze is not the enemy, it's your own team. So how do you counter your team you ask? /shrug

Every season I make silver 1 for my series to get into gold 5. Last season I quit entirely to go play CS:GO and when I came back I was decayed to silver 5. After doing my 10 match making games I was placed in Bronze 2 "fair enough" and I thought it would be a piece of cake to get myself out of wood tier considering they are bronze right? but you have to take into account that you also have bronze players on your own team. I'm not really saying that new players are bad because that would be fairly toxic

I would like to however point out that considering I am roughly a gold 5 skilled player who started from season 2 and even I am having difficulties getting out of bronze. Infact I was demoted to bronze 3 hahahaha...   shit.. :( 

This screen shot is my regular score.. it's nothing special for a fiddlesticks but yeah we lost and it happens ALOT.

replies.body:
Hey dude,

It looks like you had an annoying game with a troll (dat ez though). It is frustrating that some games are unwinnable. BUT you shouldn't focus on these rare unwinnable games, dont let them put you on tilt.

> Here is a visual guide on how carrying can't help you win games.

You say the above statement but when I look at your history out of your past 8 fiddlesticks games you have won 6. It's pretty clear your fiddle is good and you're carrying no problem? I am confused as to why you chose this one game to make a generalized statement about.

Pick someone who can not only team fight but can push lanes and take towers relatively quickly.

Its all well and good going 4 for 5 in a teamfight. but if your the last man standing as fiddle you aren't going to be threatening the enemy nexus anytime soon.

Once you hit an elo where you feel you no longer need to (or can't) solo carry, then you can bring out the other "helping the team" picks.

Exactly! recently I've been looking into Rammus top (sounds funny) but it's been working quite well in bronze I found. He does decent damage to most melee a part from Jax and Darius, I can tank so I get to choose when to initiate but that's even if my team will join in lol it's funny watching them run away sometimes. His ult can kill turrets too which I didn't know and I smash them down pretty fast. He's a lot of fun and I may use him to get out of bronze or heimerdinger mid.

Thank you again for your advice!

So you built a liandries against 5 squishies instead of full ap?

Your garen had a positive score who almost built correctly and your MF had the most cs in the game and maxed build.

You had 4 people on your team who maxed build and one obvious troll.

Am I missing something because apparently you had more than half a team who were doing more than afk, it also looks like by your kda and your lack of damage from your items against your opponents that you were on clean up duty.

It looks like you actually went in after everyone else already initiated and got most of the kills after your team initiated.

If you really want to see an unwinnable game check this one out in my promos.

In this game i equaled over 79% of the enemy teams combined cs and got over 71% of my teams kills.

Your garen had a positive score who almost built correctly

yes yes, garen needs that on hit mana return item....sure it gives AD and lifesteal, but hydra/BT is infinitely better on melee and BT is infinitely better on ranged. let alone the fact the mana return does nothing for garen. CDR, slight reason there....

overall you are right, but i wanted to point out the essence reaver garen....

Sure it is not a 100% effective item on garen but it also gives cdr with its ad and lifesteal.

Basically the most damage that garen should have had is the frozen mallet, but at least he built a few armour and health items to make him a bruiser instead of a glass cannon

We had a full team. Garen was unsure of how to initiate, MF was only farming and always late to team fights. Ez wasn't trolling he did alright and I got my score solo without the team when they attempted to take a turret I went in and melted everyone. 

The build I chose was a very very end game thing as an attempt to make me tankier but still be able to do significant damage vs the tanks. It was kind of a panic build after Id had Rabadons, Hourglass, Void staff, boots and banshee's veil but I was still dying way to fast without the team.
holy %%%%ing %%%% garen bought an essence reaver
Is that a good thing or a bad thing? haha

Well before this topic gets out of hand and I start bringing in all the "cancer patients" (as the kids are saying) than a public hospital. I'm just going to say thank you for all the replies and I think the best comment here goes to BarryButcher. You confirmed my suspicions on choosing the right champion for the job. Id also like to give thanks to the man himself for giving the worst reply on this topic not only in my thread but in many others. The one, the only VENI VIDI VICI. Give yourself a pat on the back! :P 

Also I hope that I've brought a few people together in their heated discussions on how to build a Garen and I also hope that I've helped Niji with his queries. You can add me in-game any time you like. 

Peace.

in bronze
the first team to die are the ones that are going to lose the game.


pick someone who can kill or do tons of aoe damage in teamfights. Fiddles good with good ults.

I am currently B2 I am hoping to get silver maybe I am getting a fair bit of lp per win 25-30 and only losing 10-15 but I think personally I am gonna wait it out a month or two until %%%% calms down then make the climb maybe you should do the same because for all you know as the system is now half the enemy team could be gold elo bronzes.

Haha well I don't disagree with that statement as I'm one of them. I like to analyze the game however and try to push myself through. The best part about being in bronze is that it doesn't matter how much you die you can experiment, try tower diving with a new champion or just learn counter jungling (what your boundaries are) it can be fun and it can teach you a lot more rather than being to afraid to try new things because you don't want to lose games.

The choice is yours but I do wish you luck in your games!
Then there is the fact that other people who don't belong in Bronze may be on the enemy team. You have to carry the trolls on your team above the enemy who is carrying.
True. But the question is. How to carry?

Maraudaur thanks for your reply! 

Well I used this game in particular because if you could look back further than 10 games you would see 4 losses in a row here and there. Although it looks like I am winning the majority of my games I am still only gaining 16 points per win and losing 21 points per loss.  
The problem here is that in bronze people are over extending to often, not warding or warding correctly (poor placement) building incorrectly (I can't talk because of my build but that was a last minute thing I changed as an attempt to counter 5 people on my nexus)

They aren't sure on how to initiate or team fight for that matter I find that they are unsure of who to focus or how to use their abilities to peel etc etc. Above all of those things they don't communicate or listen which makes it very difficult. I'm not frustrated don't get me wrong I have a good laugh and I think it's cute mainly because they are new players I'm assuming and I do like to teach people. I know I wont be in bronze for long.

I posted this for a bit of fun, not to complain. As for the ezrael he wasn't trolling he just gave up at the very last minute. I have sympathy for peoples frustration. Somehow I am wondering though if we can reach a wider audience to teach people how to play just like that aus chatroom that was opened a while ago that had diamond players mentoring new players.

As for veni vidi vici the screenshot is just evidence of how difficult it "can" be so your comment is contradictory to other discussions. 
It reminds me much of when bronze players were teaming up with platinums to carry games and if you sent Riot a complaint

They would reply with "We're sorry you're having this difficulty but rank does not determine skill." 
where as most people would say that it does, so who is right? That is why they put a cap on the gap now. You know what I mean?

bronze 3 nuff said. anyone can get kills in bronze, hey i used to get 20-40 killstreaks on some champs
you're in bronze for a reason. learn to get out of it.
